intro: Hieracium benzianum subsp. ausserdorferi, commonly known as the Austrian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom from June to August. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 cm. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branching. It is a relatively rare species, with limited distribution and specific habitat requirements.
